sentence: I had the pleasure of seeing Mr. Russell Urban in Cardiology Clinic today.
label: Other

sentence: As you know, Mr. Urban is a very pleasant 50-year-old gentleman who on July 09, 2093, while sitting at a concert in Central Park had the sudden onset of feeling    unwell   , epigastric discomfort, and profound diaphoresis.
label: Other

sentence: He came to the Worthington Regional Hospital Emergency Room at that time.
label: Other

sentence: By the time he arrived, his symptoms had abated.
label: Other

sentence: He had an unremarkable electrocardiogram initially and negative cardiac markers, and was admitted to the medicine service to rule-out a myocardial infarction.
label: event

sentence: That evening, he had recurrent symptoms and was noted to have sustained wide complex tachycardia, which appears to be ventricular tachycardia.
label: Other

sentence: He was transferred to the Cardiac Care Unit for further management.
label: Other

sentence: The next morning, he underwent cardiac ultrasound, which revealed an ejection fraction of 28% and a diffusely hypokinetic left ventricle with an akinetic inferior wall.
label: Other

sentence: Additionally his next set of cardiac markers returned positive.
label: test

sentence: He therefore went cardiac catheterization revealing a total occlusion of his right coronary artery and minimal non-obstructive disease of the left system.
label: test

sentence: This artery was stented with total of three stents (two Express stents 2.5 x 24 mm and one Pixel stent 2.5 x 28 mm), encompassing the entire length of the right coronary artery.
label: event

sentence: A left ventriculogram was performed and demonstrated an ejection fraction of 30% with a diffusely hypokinetic ventricle and and akinetic inferior wall.
label: Other

sentence: He ruled in for myocardial infarction with a peak CK of 1490 and a peak troponin of 2.0.
label: event

sentence: A follow-up echocardiogram was performed on July 15, 2093.
label: Other

sentence: This study showed his ejection fraction had improved to 36%; the left ventricle was diffusely hypokinetic and the inferior wall appeared severely hypokinetic.
label: Other

sentence: His reduced ejection fraction was out of proportion to his degree of coronary disease.
label: mention

sentence: Because of this, a series of laboratory tests were performed which revealed normal iron studies, normal thyroid function, and a normal serum protein electrophoresis pattern.
label: Other

sentence: He was discharged in stable condition to follow up with me as an outpatient.
label: Other

sentence: Since his myocardial infarction, Mr. Urban has been feeling quite well.
label: event

sentence: He has returned to work in the factory where his employed as a manufacturing manager.
label: Other

sentence: He has had no symptoms of angina, dyspnea, nausea, or diaphoresis.
label: Other

sentence: He continues to take his medications without difficulty, and denies any symptomatology whatsoever.
label: Other

sentence: His past medical history prior to this hospitalization is largely unremarkable because he had not sought medical care.
label: Other

sentence: Of note, he reports to me that about 8 or 9 years ago while living in Georgia, he presented to an emergency room with some chest discomfort.
label: Other

sentence: He never had any further testing.
label: Other

sentence: He did not have a stress test, cardiac ultrasound or catheterization.
label: Other

sentence: Prior to his admission, he did not have any known hypertension or hyperlipidemia, but has been diagnosed with these conditions while in the hospital.
label: Other

sentence: His medications include aspirin 325 mg daily, Plavix 75 mg daily, Lipitor 20 mg daily, lisinopril 10 mg daily, and carvedilol 6.25 mg twice each day.
label: Other

sentence: He has no known drug allergies.
label: Other

sentence: Ms. Urban is originally from Nicaragua but after working for Imports, Inc, he moved to Georgia where he lived for 24 years working as a Registered Nurse and in various other positions.
label: Other

sentence: He immigrated to America about a year or so ago.
label: Other

sentence: He has been working in Borders.
label: Other

sentence: He currently lives in Toledo, Montana, with his wife.
label: Other

sentence: He smoked 1 to 1-1/2 packs per day for about 30 years, but has not smoked since his hospitalization.
label: Other

sentence: He drinks only socially and denies illicit drug use.
label: Other

sentence: He has a family history of coronary artery disease in that his father had 3 myocardial infarctions and died at a young age of heart disease.
label: event

sentence: On physical exam, his blood pressure was 130/82 mmHg in his right arm and 126/80 mmHg in his left arm.
label: Other

sentence: His heart rate is 60 and regular.
label: Other

sentence: In general, he is in no apparent distress.
label: Other

sentence: His jugular venous pressure is 6 cm of water.
label: Other

sentence: His chest is clear to auscultation without rales, wheezes, or rhonchi.
label: Other

sentence: His heart is regular in rhythm and rate with a normal S1 and S2.
label: Other

sentence: He has no murmurs, rubs, or gallops.
label: Other

sentence: His extremities are warm and well perfused and without clubbing, cyanosis, or edema.
label: Other

sentence: On vascular exam his carotid pulses are 2+, brisk and without bruits.
label: Other

sentence: His femoral pulses are 2+, brisk and without bruits.
label: Other

sentence: His right femoral artery was entered for cardiac catheterization.
label: Other

sentence: The site looks clean and intact with no hematoma and no bruit and a strong pulse.
label: Other

sentence: His distal pulses are 2+ and symmetric throughout.
label: Other

sentence: His lipid panel from his hospitalization reveals total cholesterol of 210 mg/dl, LDL of 153 mg/dl, and HDL of 45mg/dl.
label: Other

sentence: His electrocardiogram revealed normal sinus rhythm.
label: Other

sentence: He has T wave inversions in III and aVF, and he has a greater than 15 degree disparity between his R and T wave axis.
label: Other

sentence: Mr. Urban underwent a exercise treadmill test with sestamibi imaging yesterday.
label: Other

sentence: He exercised for 10 minutes 43 seconds achieving a maximum workload of 12 METS, and a peak double product of 21,600.
label: Other

sentence: His electrocardiogram was negative for ischemia.
label: Other

sentence: His nuclear images revealed a mild reduction in tracer activity in the inferior wall which persisted after reinjection consistent with his inferior myocardial infarction.
label: event

sentence: There was no evidence of ischemia elsewhere.
label: Other

sentence: His left ventricular ejection fraction was measured at 51%.
label: Other

sentence: In short, Mr. Urban is a 51-year-old who had an inferior myocardial infarction, but interestingly during his hospitalization had systolic dysfunction well out of proportion to his coronary disease.
label: event

sentence: Also, his systolic function has improved over time.
label: Other

sentence: I think there are two processes going on.
label: Other

sentence: Clearly this has manifested itself as an inferior myocardial infarction due to an occluded right coronary artery, which was treated during his hospitalization with stenting.
label: event

sentence: The other issue is his transient systolic dysfunction that is out of proportion to his coronary artery disease.
label: mention

sentence: Given the rapid improvement in his ejection fraction, I can only speculate as to the etiology of this.
label: Other

sentence: He does not appear to have a persistent cardiomyopathy, but a transient one.
label: Other

sentence: I suspect that this is myocarditis.
label: Other

sentence: Unfortunatley, I have no way of proving this for certain but clinically it seems to fit.
label: Other

sentence: It is possible that whatever led to his myocarditis also triggered his acute coronary syndrome.
label: Other

sentence: From the aspect of his coronary artery disease, he will continue on aspirin for life.
label: mention

sentence: He received quite a substantial amount of stenting to his right coronary artery, and I would opt to continue his Plavix for at least 12 months.
label: Other

sentence: For his hyperlipidemia, I agree with Lipitor, and we will recheck his lipid profile to see if the dose of Lipitor is adequate.
label: Other

sentence: His LDL goal will be less than 100.
label: Other

sentence: He is well beta-blocked on his carvedilol, and we will continue with the current dose of 6.25 mg twice daily.
label: Other

sentence: His blood pressure allows us to increase his lisinopril from 10 to 15 mg daily.
label: Other

sentence: I will see Mr. Urban again in three months for followup.
label: Other

sentence: I will repeat his echocardiogram in six months' time to see where his ejection fraction has settled out.
label: Other

sentence: Thank you for allowing me to participate in the care of this very interesting and pleasant gentleman.
label: Other

sentence: The patient was seen and examined, and the case was discussed with Dr. Orville Ness.
label: Other

sentence: I saw Mr. Urban in follow-up in the office today.
label: Other

sentence: Since his last visit in November, he has been feeling well.
label: Other

sentence: He has had no angina, no exertional dyspnea, no shortness of breath, no orthopnea, no paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea, no palpitations, and no other symptoms of note.
label: Other

sentence: Since his last visit with me, he has participated in and completed outpatient cardiac rehabilitation.
label: Other

sentence: He found this program to be very helpful; he sis very well with the program.
label: Other

sentence: He is currently exercising on a regular basis and has no chest discomfort of dyspnea with exercise.
label: Other

sentence: There have been no difficulties with his medications.
label: Other

sentence: On 03/16/2094, he had a follow-up echocardiogram done; this study shows an LV ejection fraction of 37% with septal hypokinesis and inferoposterior akinesis; there is trace mitral regurgitation; and aortic sclerosis, but no stenosis.
label: Other

sentence: Notably, he has a right ventricular systolic pressure estimated to be 46 mmHg with a right ventricle that is mildly dilated and mildly-to-moderately hypokinetic.
label: Other

sentence: He has been feeling quite well and has no other symptoms.
label: Other

sentence: His review of systems is as above and is otherwise negative in detail.
label: Other

sentence: He appears quite well and is in no apparent distress.
label: Other

sentence: His blood pressure is 112/60 mmHg and his pulse rate is 50 beats per minutes and regular.
label: Other

sentence: His JVP is 7 cm of water with no Kussmaul's sign.
label: Other

sentence: His chest is clear to auscultation bilaterally.
label: Other

sentence: His heart is regular in rhythm and rate with a normal S1 and S2.
label: Other

sentence: He has no S3 or S4 gallop and no audible murmurs.
label: Other

sentence: It is neither tender nor distended.
label: Other

sentence: His extremities are warm and well perfused.
label: Other

sentence: Impression:  This is a 50 year-old man with coronary disease who suffered an inferoposterior myocardial infarction in July 2093.
label: event

sentence: Additionally, he was also found to have cardiomyopathy with an LV ejection fraction of 37 percent.
label: event

sentence: He is currently asymptomatic from his coronary disease and his LV dysfunction.
label: mention

sentence: Notably, his last echocardiogram shows that he has increased RV systolic pressure and some early right ventricular dysfunction.
label: Other

sentence: The etiology of this right ventricular dysfunction is not clear.
label: Other

sentence: There is likely a component of left heart failure.
label: Other

sentence: In addition, he may have right heart failure out-of-proportion to left heart failure: he has a longstanding smoking history and may have a degree of COPD and, lastly, he may have obstructive sleep apnea.
label: Other

sentence: He reports to me that he does snore at night, and his first wife in Georgia had told him for many years that during the night he had periods were he would stop breathing.
label: Other

sentence: This raises obstructive sleep apnea as a consideration.
label: Other

sentence: Recommendations: Initially, I am going to start him on Lasix 20 mg daily to lower his preload to help with any component of LV failure that is leading to this.
label: Other

sentence: The rest of his regimen is quite good, and I intend to continue them.
label: Other

sentence: To help to see if there is any component of cor pulmonale that may be contributing to this, I am going to obtain first a chest x-ray, secondly a pulmonary function testing, and lastly a sleep study.
label: Other

sentence: If indeed we find components of obstructive lung disease or obstructive sleep apnea, we will have him see a pulmonologist and treat these accordingly.
label: Other

sentence: I had the pleasure of seeing Hannah Hendricks in Internal Medicine today.
label: Other

sentence: She was seen alongside my attending, Dr. Heidi Erik-Roy.
label: Other

sentence: As you know, she is a lovely 52-year-old female in whom you have found a left lower extremity bypass surgery.
label: Other

sentence: She comes in today for perioperative risk assessment.
label: Other

sentence: Ms. Hendricks tells me that she has longstanding type 1 diabetes, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and peripheral arterial disease.
label: Other

sentence: She in fact has undergone lower extremity bypass grafting in both her left and right lower extremities.
label: Other

sentence: Specifically, she is status post a right fem-pop bypass in 2066 and a left fem-DP bypass also in 2066.
label: Other

sentence: It appears that her right graft has been functioning well, but her left graft was noted to be occluded many years ago.
label: Other

sentence: She comes in now with a nonhealing ulcer and gangrene in her left toe.
label: Other

sentence: You have planned a redo bypass for this upcoming Saturday.
label: Other

sentence: Ms. Hendricks tells me that she has never had any history of coronary artery disease.
label: Other

sentence: She has never had any chest discomfort, shortness of breath, orthopnea, PND, lower extremity edema, palpitations, lightheadedness, or syncope.
label: Other

sentence: She does have a strong family history of coronary artery disease with a brother who had several myocardial infarctions and died at the age of 48 of an MI.
label: Other

sentence: She has a report of a prior EKG with suggestion of an old anteroseptal MI.
label: event

sentence: She has never had any evaluation for underlying coronary artery disease nor has she had any symptoms referable to CAD.
label: mention

sentence: In terms of her functional capacity, she tells me that up until a year ago, she was doing spinning classes without any chest discomfort or shortness of breath whatsoever.
label: Other

sentence: Because of increasing discomfort in her left lower extremity, she had to reduce her exercise and of late has only been able to do weightlifting without aerobic exercise.
label: Other

sentence: She is however able to climb stairs in her home without any discomfort in her chest or any shortness of breath.
label: Other

sentence: She is unfortunately limited significantly by foot pain.
label: Other

sentence: Her past medical history is as noted above including type 1 diabetes for which she uses an insulin pump, peripheral arterial disease, status post bilateral lower extremity bypass, hypertension, and hyperlipidemia.
label: Other

sentence: Her current medications include aspirin 325 mg, which she started a few days ago, Lipitor 10 mg once daily, Diovan 160 mg twice daily, vitamin C, vitamin B and folic acid supplementation.
label: Other

sentence: She has no clear drug allergies, but does get nauseous and vomiting with Percocet.
label: Other

sentence: She is a past smoker and had smoked for approximately three years, one pack per day in her early 20s.
label: Other

sentence: She works as a Senior Manager of Broadcasting at giant food in Albemarle.
label: Other

sentence: As I mentioned previously, her family history is notable for a brother who died of an MI in his late 40s.
label: Other

sentence: On physical examination, her blood pressure is 135/79, heart rate is 97 and her weight is 137 pounds.
label: Other

sentence: In general, she is very well appearing and in no apparent distress at rest.
label: Other

sentence: She has a jugular venous pressure of approximately 5 cm of water.
label: Other

sentence: She has 2+ carotids with no audible bruits.
label: Other

sentence: Her upper extremities demonstrate 2+ brachial and radial pulses bilaterally.
label: Other

sentence: Her chest is clear to auscultation bilaterally.
label: Other

sentence: Her cardiac exam reveals a regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 and S2, and a soft 2/6 systolic ejection murmur best heard at the left sternal border.
label: Other

sentence: She has no abdominal bruits and no significantly palpable aorta.
label: Other

sentence: Her lower extremity exam is notable for a hyperemic left foot with a bandage, which is covering what is reportedly a gangrenous toe.
label: Other

sentence: Her left lower extremity pulses are 1+ in the femoral, absent popliteal and absent distal pulses.
label: Other

sentence: In her right lower extremity, she has 1+ femoral, with no bruit, 2+ popliteal, 2+ DP and 1+ PT.
label: Other

sentence: An EKG done in our clinic today demonstrates a normal sinus rhythm at a rate of 97 beats per minute with a left axis deviation.
label: Other

sentence: There is left atrial enlargement and Q-waves in V1 through V3 suggestive of an old anteroseptal MI.
label: Other

sentence: There are also Q-waves in lead III and aVF, which raises suspicion of an old inferior MI.
label: event

sentence: In summary, Ms. Hendricks is a lovely 52-year-old female with longstanding diabetes, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and peripheral arterial disease who comes in today for perioperative risk assessment in light of an anticipated redo left lower extremity bypass graft.
label: Other

sentence: She appears to have an excellent functional capacity up until several months ago.
label: Other

sentence: However, I am concerned by her electrocardiogram, which raises the suspicion of underlying coronary artery disease given the findings of a probable inferior and old anteroseptal myocardial infarction.
label: mention

sentence: As such, I think that it would be wise to better delineate her burden of coronary artery disease by way of a stress test prior to her surgery.
label: Other

sentence: Given that her functional status has been so good up until recently, I do not think that we need to delay her surgery.
label: Other

sentence: However, I would start her on a beta-blocker and as such, I have given her a prescription for atenolol 25 mg once daily, which she will start today and continue up to and beyond the perioperative period.
label: Other

sentence: During the perioperative period, we would recommend that she has tight control of her blood pressure and heart rate with a goal blood pressure less than 120/80 and a goal heart rate less than 60.
label: Other

sentence: I would also make sure to obtain a postoperative EKG to ensure there has not been any changes.
label: Other

sentence: We will try to arrange for an exercise test with arm ergometry and MIBI imaging for tomorrow morning.
label: Other

sentence: If we are unable to do arm exercise, we will obtain an adenosine MIBI.
label: Other

sentence: I will follow up with the results tomorrow after the study is performed.
label: Other

sentence: As I mentioned because her functional capacity is good, I do not anticipate that we will need to make any changes in the surgical scheduling based on the test results.
label: Other

sentence: This is more in order to give us a sense of the underlying burden of coronary artery disease.
label: mention

sentence: It was a pleasure seeing Ms. Hendricks in clinic today.
label: Other

sentence: We are certainly available during the perioperative period if any cardiovascular issues are to arise.
label: Other

sentence: Please feel free to contact me with any questions.
label: Other
